Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Families”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Landis a number of times on our way to/from Whistler. The suites are great value for our family of 5, with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, and a kitchen for the times you want to eat in. There is a 7-11 over the road, and lots of cheap restaurants locally. The continental breakfast is pretty basic and it was unfortunate that the pool complex was closed on our last visit, as the kids really appreciate a swim after a long flight. The hotel is not as centrally located as many, but still quite walkable to many destinations. There is also a free shuttle for downtown drop-offs. The front desk staff are friendly, helpful and informative. Special thanks to Ali for his superb service on our recent stay. Kate, Wellington NZ

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Day Long Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ernie47
Reviews.Content: Taking advantage of the Family Holiday in Alberta, we spent the long weekend in Vancouver staying at the Landis Hotel and Suites. The hotel staff is very welcoming setting a very tone to our stay at the Landis. The hotel is centrally located and gives us an opportunity to walk to almost any destination in the city centre or Granivlle Island just across the bridge. The hotel also provides a breakfast opportunity that is very much appreciated. We have chosen the Landis for four years and will continue to return as guests are treated very well during your Vancouver stay. Thanks to the management and staff of the Hotel! Ernest, Edmonton

Reviews.Title: “Room 824”
Reviews.Author: pigkey
Reviews.Content: Party of 5 staying in a 2 bedroom with a pullout couch. This place was great for the living room space, separate kitchen and extra mini dining room. It also provides a continental breakfast! However, there was only 1 bathroom and the spa downstairs was being renovated. Its a comfy stay for 5 people over a few nights but I wouldn't stay here again for the same price. The hotel is about a 10-15 min walk to the train station... So during winter, it wasn't a comfy walk for us. Our other friends stayed in better hotels in better locations for a similar price with online deals. There's a 7/11 conveniently downstairs along with being walking distance to lots of restaurants/cafes, but the train station and town centre are a much further walk away. Overall, I had a pleasant experience, but I wouldn't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Family of 6 stay in comfort!”
Reviews.Author: BCGirlie
Reviews.Content: Between Christmas and New Year we decided to hop off Vancouver Island and visit the big city :) We wanted a place that allowed our family to enjoy each other's company rather than be placed in separate hotel rooms. This was a great choice when the cost is split across 2 families. 2 couples and 2 teenagers fit perfect in this 'condo' accommodation. As described in many reviews the place is spacious. We loved having a 'dining area' which provided more open space for all of us to sit, for relaxing and for the meals that were easily made in the kitchen. 1 large King bed room with ensuite, decent Queen bed room, pullout sofa couch and main bathroom, kitchen, living, dining plus a small covered in patio area. The 7th floor worked out great although I did try to get higher (was told the available rooms weren't in good repair at the time). The place was very clean and tidy, not luxurious but certainly not dowdy. The breakfast was a very basic continental - cereal/breads/danishes/banana or apple, coffee and juice but if you team that up with some groceries in your kitchen you can start your day off right. I think they should add some protein - yogurts and boiled eggs, cheese strings. No pool, being renovated but if we wanted to walk to another hotel....? We didn't. The underground parking did look a bit dodgy LOL You drive around the back, turn right, where its a bit rough and there was a lot of construction which when workers were there the gate wasn't always closed. We didn't experience any problems, it just looked a little unsavoury around there. We visited Capilano Suspension bridge which although we choked at the $30 entrance fee, thoroughly enjoyed. There are nice boardwalk trails, a treetop suspension walk and the bridge itself. We had great fun taking pictures and hanging out as a family. Even the teenagers weren't bored. However, Grouse Moutain was a big disappointment. $40 each to go up the cable car!! There were a few actiities if you weren't skiing but very busy and not well organized (sleigh ride). We could only afford to send 2 of our group up there and thank goodness only 2 because it was so foggy and overcast they couldn't get any photo's. For non-payers who stay at the bottom, you can sit at Starbucks and also view the 3 wolves they have protected onsite. We caught feeding time and the staff gave us some history on these 3 'movie' stars who are now enjoying their retirement. Vancouver is always lots of fun and I'd return to this hotel again if we travelled as a large family where the cost can be split and more space is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: yeva0111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for just a night for a quick trip from Seattle and needed two bedrooms for our family of four, plus my parents. The unit was very spacious and comfortable for us all, and the master bedroom was large enough for two pack'n'plays (supplied by the hotel) for our two year old and 5 month old. Huge master bath with double sinks, tub and separate shower. Decor/furnishings were in good shape. Parking was $20 a night. We did not use the kitchen but I checked the drawers and there isn't a whole lot supplied, mainly some dishes and basic counter top appliances. Not even paper towels or kitchen towels as far as I could find. My mom, who is a clean freak and basically lives on tea, did not appreciate some of the stains she found on the handle of the electric tea kettle. G sports bar is two blocks away on Granville, the one sports bar in the city where you can watch other sports (we were looking for a place that had the Rose Bowl on) besides hockey. It was pouring the entire trip, so even though the location is a bit farther to walk to the sights of Stanely Park, for example, had we had time to go there anyway we probably would have driven.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: georgie2810
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment with my family in December '11. I was very happy with the hotel in every regard. The rooms are spacious and clean, with a nice view of the city, especially at night. They are comfortable and equipped with kitchen facilities which is very convenient. The location was good, easy walking distance from the 'Down Town Vancouver' train stop, even with heavy bags. There are a range of cafes etcetera near by and a 7-11 literally next door (across the road). The hotel manager was friendly and efficient but could have perhaps been a little more helpful when we arrived a bit earlier than expected. Overall very happy with the stay and Vancouver in general.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, large suites”
Reviews.Author: Stang1sk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Grey Cup weekend and had one of the large, two bedroom, two bath suites. It's a nice hotel with helpful staff and a good location. There were some problems with the hotel elevators breaking down but that is probably due to the unusual number of people staying there for the Cup. The only complaint we have is the street noise. We were on the seventh floor and surprised to be able to hear everything going on outside, including people collecting bottles from garbage cans at 2 in the morning. The breakfast was okay but would suggest to the hotel to add some kind of protein like yogurt or hard boiled eggs. The selection was limited to toast, pastry and cereal. We'd definitely stay here again for the price, convenience and large rooms but would request a suite on a higher floor in hopes that it would cut down the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very large suites”
Reviews.Author: CBM_20
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so large that there are only four on each floor. Our Suite was layed out very well with a bedroom at each end of the large living area. The kitchen had full-size appliances including dishwasher. Three LCD TV's, free WIFI & continental breakfast. We were on the 7th floor and slept pretty well - there wasn't too much city noise. Parking was $20 extra. It certainly is a 'downtown hotel' - seems to be just on the border between the sleazy neighborhood and the professional, depending on which way you want to walk. Many, many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinker1bellPa
Reviews.Content: My BFF and two other friends and I really enjoyed our stay at the Landis Hotel. We were so fortunate to find such a diamond and affordable place for the four of us. The pictures on the site do not do it justice. We were just amazed at how nice it was. Lots of space to spread out. Comfortable beds, beautiful views and very clean. The 2 bedroom suite was perfect and I wish we could have stayed longer. Great choices for breakfast. The spa was spacious and I wish we had had time to use the jacuzzi. The manager Khaled, (the bald guy) was so very helpful with loads of great information. On his advice, we took the hop off-hop on bus and that evening, we went to Earls for the best pizza and drinks ever. I would recommend this location to anyone staying in Vancouver. I would go back in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Taste downtown living while on vacation.”
Reviews.Author: TMay72
Reviews.Content: My friends & I enjoyed our recent stay at The Landis. The location is great--nice walking distance to lots of restaurants and the shops on Robson Street. Provided a good home base while in Vancouver. The elevators are small and slow but the suite made up for that. Our 2-bedroom suite had comfortable beds, nice living room area, kitchen and not 1 but 3 decent size flat screen tv! Our favorite room in the suite was the dining area, which was mostly surrounded by floor to ceiling---provided nice views in the morning & night. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “perfekt”
Reviews.Author: nattrissen
Reviews.Content: 17 nights at this hotel made our trip to Vancouver perfekt. Its clean and has a lot og spase in the apartments. Helpful and frendly staf.everything is in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fitted our Needs MORE THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: Garfield254
Reviews.Content: We needed a suite hotel room for a couple as a double queen beds in Vancouver are 200 a night mostly. The landis hotel offers suites wit 2 bedrooms with full bathrooms a kitchen and dining room plus a breakfast nook over the street. The windows are full wall length with a view of a city like no other in Canada. The staff are very helpful and friendly to assist you whether sightseeing or needing a medical clinic Complmentary breakfast is not found in other hotels downtown and this one has lots to get you going in the morning. Nice pol and fitness center. Even a barbecue you can use if you want steaks when you have a full dining area in your room. The shuttle driver Stan will take you anywhere and tell you about the city in a pleasant no rush moment which is great for touring telling you where it's safe to walk and where not. For couples or a small family and you want to see Vancouver. The Landis is the place not just a one wall suite it's a small apt. at hotel cost cheaper if your a AAA/CAA or senior. Good restaurants,grocery stores,just short blocks away and in the hub of night life entertainment. Save money when you have 3 couples big time . Vancouver makes Toronto look like terrible .Vancouver has places to walk and sites to see with entertaining street people performing for money not begging like T.O. If you got 1500 and want a get away weekend go to Vancouver and stay at the Landis tell Kaileb the manager, Gerry sent you rm 1521 he'll give you a deal. Guranteed

Reviews.Title: “Good for an average priced city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruralgirl08
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, not great. A few cosmetic issues. Wet rugs and A/C issues were dealt with promptly by staff. Breakfast was fine, but they need another toaster. Work being done left pool and workout area a little dirty. Pool itself was fine, but no towels. Helpful front desk. Great shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was spacious just the space we needed for family of 5”
Reviews.Author: Sharon091
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very central to get around Vancouver. Had 2 bedrooms (1 king bed & 1 queen bed), living room with fold out couch, kitchen and dining area. There was also a safe in the room. It was all the space we needed to spread out. We were given a room on a corner of the building on the 11th floor, and the whole room had glass windows so the only problem we had was street noise which ranged from people yelling late at night or sirens going. Overall it was handy to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great two-bedroom in nice location.”
Reviews.Author: beaucat
Reviews.Content: Room had two bedrooms with living room and kitchenette (with full size fridge.) Only one bathroom. Room was very clean and staff was helpful. Good location - lots of ethnic restaurants nearby. Can walk to Stanley park although it is quite a hike. Granville island is relatively close.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home When In Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 44aries
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six week stay at the Landis Hotel & Suites. The suites are very spacious, clean, and a well-stocked kitchen for preparing meals. The location is absolutely perfect and staff and management are professional, courteous, and responsive to your needs. We are looking forward to returning to the Landis next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel found at the last minute!”
Reviews.Author: JacSchapel
Reviews.Content: We found the Landis on a whim after needing accom in Vancouver on the Friday of the July long weekend at the last minute. They accomodated 5 of us comfortably in an exectutive suite and even upgraded us to a larger suite when the bathroom door locked us out. Fantastic service and great value. Superb location for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: rekBerkeley_CA
Reviews.Content: Three of us, my husband and I and his sister, had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite at this hotel. Included were a full kitchen, dining area, living room, and glassed-in terrace. The suite was very clean, spacious, decently furnished, and had very comfortable beds. We did not use the laundry facility, but I believe it is available at reasonable cost. The fitness center was unavailable because of maintenance, but there is a pool and jacuzzi. Parking was provided free - - unusual for central Vancouver hotels. The location is 2 blocks from Davie street, which is lined with restaurants. Several banks and bus stops are close by. The manager and staff are all very friendly and helpful. A so-so breakfast is provided. Free shuttle service is provided to downtown locations. My only criticism is that when we asked for restaurant recommendations, the manager had gone for the evening, and the (younger) night staff weren't really well-informed about good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great for two couples”
Reviews.Author: shelbymom
Reviews.Content: Our two bedroom suite had a perfect layout for two couples traveling together. The bedrooms were on either side of the living room/dining room areas. We each had our own bathroom. The furnishings were fresh, modern, and comfortable. The galley kitchen allowed us to put together easy breakfasts or just bring back breakfast items from the one provided by the Landis. It was also nice to have the living room to hang out and chat over a few beers in the evening. There's the neatest little glassed-in space off of the living room. My husband could sit there with his computer, close the sliding glass door, get a little work done, and glance out to watch the world go by below. The location of the hotel was very handy and it was an easy downhill walk to the little boat that goes over to to Granville Island. It was also a short to walk to Yaletown. Among the site-seeing brochures in the lobby of the Landis we discovered some free tickets to a nearby blues club at The Yale Hotel. We had a great time people watching there and hearing a couple of good bands. Parking was pricey, but it always is in downtown locations. Staffers were pleasant and unobtrusive. It's easy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL IN AN AMAZING CITY!”
Reviews.Author: MR44
Reviews.Content: There were so many enjoyable aspects of this hotel; I don't really know where to start. Incredible location, walking distance to amazing restaurants, beaches, shopping and transit to and from the city. The customer service at Landis Hotel and Suites was by far the best I've received in a while. Starting out with the friendly and professional Khaled Ali, the GM of Landis, he was so helpful, courteous and a joy to chat with. He helped us with everything from bike rentals to get around the city to really helpful restaurant recommendations. Our room was so comfortable, clean and spacious. It really was a nice romantic getaway destination. Even the in-room coffee was delicious and it's been a while since I've had really good in-room coffee... I think it was called Canterbury?? Not too sure, but a DELICIOUS way to start or end the day. I think this hotel would be great for all travel and hotel purposes. I personally was there on holiday with my boyfriend, but I think it would be great for families as well as business. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay in downtown Vancouver, BC and furthermore, I will definitely stay here on my next visit. There was so much to do in Vancouver... hopefully next time we'll have a chance to get up to Whistler, I hear it's amazing!! Thank you Khaled for your amazing hospitality and sharing your wonderful hotel with my boyfriend and I! We will definitely be seeing you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: raneflight
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for a night, but we had a really nice suite, we had 2 bedroom one bath suite and it was very nice! There was a lot of space and lots of windows! The dining room was like on the balcony, it was enclosed by glass windows and doors. The bathroom was large and clean and the bedrooms are decent. Only complaint is that the light switch are in total random places. There was complimentary breakfast and wifi and apples at the front desk! The breakfast wasn't too bad, there is the usual coffee, tea and juice as well as toast and some individually wrapped muffins, croissant and what looked like ground beef in phylo pastry... (wonder what that would taste like...) The wifi wasn't the greatest even with the route outside our door. However, the hotel next door had great wifi! All-in-all, this is a great place to stay and I would stay here again! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: ckrystek
Reviews.Content: I could not believe everything that was wrong with this hotel, and it has such great reviews. Hotel couldn't have smelled worse, very slow elevators, very hard to find parking in garage, and very low quality overall. Room also smelled, our fridge was broken-however they sent up a replacement fridge within a three phone calls to front desk. Maid service was questionable at best, many nights beds were really not made as for sheets were still at bottom of bed. Bathroom fan was stuck on for entire trip after couple calls, not a big deal just loud. Room has no AC, got a little warm at nights, and with its great location to "Davie" street noise levels were unbearable. Every night an arrest was made outside our hotel that we could see from our windows. This place is for a special type of person, not families. Its location really isn't as great as everyone mentions, you are still blocks away from where you would want to be.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: cleo30
Reviews.Content: we booked three executive suites in the landis after extensive web search, and checking up with TA of course. i found the landis to be an exact match for our requirements for a downtown vancouver property. travelling with teens we wanted space and comfort, self catering and a good location. the suite was spacious, with a roomy living room, adequate kitchen ( which we made full use of!), two comfortable bedrooms-one with a king and the other with a queen bed. the decor is on the bland side but the units are pleasant and attractive.the dining is a lovely glass enclosed space. the suite comes with toiletries, an ironing board and iron and an umbrella( a thoughtful touch!). the hotel offers a continental breakfast which is good but carb rich. we had stocked up on groceries including breakfast goodies, so we invariably loaded up trays from the breakfast room and headed back to our rooms to add on eggs, bacon etc for a hearty start to the day. the hotel also has self laundry facilities at a nominal charge. tea/coffee making is also available in the suites. the landis is superbly located with granville island, granville street, robson, -all the downtown attractions in fact, located nearby. we walked practically everywhere, and the free downtown shuttle drop was pretty convenient. the shuttle dropped us to the cruise ship terminal as well. do remember to put in a word at the reception in advance since it is gets quite busy. there is a 7-11 right across the street, which in my opinion should only be an emergency/last resort kind of option to buy anything. there are plenty of restaurants situated near the landis, with a Subway in every direction i think! the hotel has a small independent sort of spa, which i didnt have the time to try. though our teens were disappointed that the swimming pool which was to have become operational by May end, (post repairs) was not .the reception area is unimpressive,but the front desk was uniformly friendly and helpful, most so mr. khaled ali, the manager. the landis suites are an excellent choice fro vancouver, specially families1

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great suites, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mathviking
Reviews.Content: Five in our party - two couples, one toddler. We reserved a two bedroom, two bath suite which included a large kitchen, dining area, living room, and enclosed patio. A rollaway bed fit in the master bedroom for the little one. All windows had lovely views of Vancouver and the mountains. The hotel offers one-way shuttle to downtown locations which was convenient for getting to Stanley Park, SkyTrain, Canada Place. However, the walks aren't long to most destinations. We did one dinner in the suite with goodies we bought at Granville Market (take the aquabus from up the street). We also enjoyed dinners at La Brasserie, Twisted Fork, Yaletown Brewing Company, and The Templeton. The last two were especially kid-friendly and reasonably priced. The suite was very spacious and clean. The breakfast was typical continental fare, but good.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, spacious”
Reviews.Author: cchanmen
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Vancouver, near Granville Island, just across from a 7-eleven, and with many eateries within walking distance. Our favourite was Shizenya, a Japanese restaurant 3 blocks away, that serves organic vegan japanese food. Our executive suite (room 422) was clean and spacious. The master bedroom has a king bed, and the other bedroom has a queen. The sofa in the living room can open into a 3rd bed if you wished. The dining room has a paranomic view of the surroundings, but given our 4th floor location, there wasn't much to see, and pretty much kept the blinds down to keep away from prying eyes. 30+ inch LCD TVs in every room, which made the kids happy. There was a safe in the master bedroom. During our stay, the fitness room was under renovation, but Landis had made an arrangement with Cascadia Suites next door for us to use their fitness room, which was a hotel room converted into a fitness room on the 21st floor consisting of only a treadmill and stationary bike. Laundry facilities available in the men's and women's restroom on the 2nd floor, just outside the being-renovated fitness center. 1 washer and 1 dryer in the men's room. I believe the same in the women's room too. We didn't use them, so can't comment further. There was one bathroom with shower and bath and toilet together. 2 sinks. Free WiFi, which worked very speedily I must say for a hotel. There's free breakfast every morning - your typical continental stuff with some fruits and baked goods. We didn't bother going to the 2nd floor cafe for it, and heard it was normal. Be warned that this is quite far from Stanley Park, which is a beautiful place to spend a day with the family. Good news is that Landis provides a free shuttle to anywhere downtown, including Stanley Park, but you'll need to find your way back. Buses in Vancouver are CAD$2.50 for 90mins. You'll need to take 2 buses back to Hornby, where Landis is. The driver who drove us to Stanley Park was extremely professional and courteous. Our wishlist for improvement: 1) More attentive maintenance / repairs - one of the master bedroom cabinet mirrors had a crack, and when we reported it to the front desk, the lady just noted it down, but didn't seem very interested. One of the blinds in our dining area also had a broken string, but we didn't bother reporting that one, since we wanted to keep the blinds down anyway. 2) The bathroom was sufficient for my family of 5, but there were times I wished there was another toilet (not full bath facilities) available. 3) Extend free shuttle service to Granville island, which is very difficult to get to on foot, even though it is so near. Taxi ride would be about CAD$9 each way. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in heart of City”
Reviews.Author: kdeogburn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents after a 10 night cruise that started in San Diego and disembarked in Vacouver. I booked this hotel based on the positive feedback and reviews I read on tripadvisor. It felt like we were staying in an apartment rather than a hotel. I booked us a 2 bedroom/1 bath suite that was very spacious, it had a living room, small kitchen and a glassed in dining room with great views of the city. We stayed on the 7th floor, there were plenty of restaurants and shops nearby all within walking distance which made it very convenient. In the future, I would like to come back to Vancouver and stay at this hotel for a longer stay. The staff was very friendly and I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location.”
Reviews.Author: jillann24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Landis with my husband and another couple for 5 days. We enjoyed the hotel and were very please with how central the location was. I had booked from the internet and was not sure of what to expect. The layout of the suite was terrific and gave each couple their own space. I would certainly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “super alternative”
Reviews.Author: mama4llama
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my daughter, son, and grandson to a conference that she was attending. Conference hotels ran about $250+ per standard room. We got a large 2 bdrm apartment style suite for $233 including not only breakfast, but a free shuttle to anywhere in downtown. This was from the hotel, but not return to the hotel, yet it saved us time and tons of money for cabs. Each AM she took the shuttle to the conference at the Convention Center, and we took it to different local tourist spots including right to the front door of the aquarium. The front desk was welcoming, and very helpful with any request. Our apartment was spotless when we arrived, good beds, excellent air conditioning, nice view out of the rooms, good cross ventilation for fresh air, 2 full baths, 3 TV and vcr player for movies we brought with us. It's a very easy walk to a great variety of restaurants, 2.5 blks to a grocery, and 3 blks to a park for kids. Hop of Hop on Trolley stops right next door at Cascadia who gave us a great discount on a 2 day ticket when we bought it at the Cascadia front desk. We not only used it to see the sights of this beautiful, fun, welcoming city, but in place of taxis to get around. Daily maid service made this a hotel. Loved having a full kitchen for snacks and a few eat-in meals during our week long stay. Pool and spa were closed while we were there, should be open in a month. Free wifi in rooms with good speed and connection.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: salporritt
Reviews.Content: This is a little treasure right in the middle of Vancouver. We stayed there for a week and were able to access everywhere that we wanted to be. Very clean rooms and relaxed atmosphere. The breakfast room was a friendly place to start your day, easily engaging in conversation with other residents, the reception was always welcoming and efficient. We want to go back again, and take our family with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great find that met expectations.”
Reviews.Author: TeamHayes
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this is not the Ritz. However, to find reasonably priced suite-accomodations with a full kitchen and two full baths in Vancouver is a small feat unto itself. The room was clean and comfortable with a lovely glassed-in balcony for people-watching. The bathrooms were spacious with plenty of towels. The staff members were courteous and helpful. When I mentioned that there was only one hairdryer for two bathrooms, they brought me another one within 5 minutes of calling. The kitchen was adequately equipped, but it would have been nice to have a few more serving dishes (as a former New Yorker, I think the restaurant prices in Vancouver are OUTRAGEOUS, and that is saying something:) ), but all appliances functioned well and were easy to use. Location is another big plus for this hotel. It was a 20-minute drive from the airport, and Canada Place was within walking distance. The only two negatives I can think of were street-noise issues (we were on the 9th floor and could still hear street-side hockey celebrations) and the laundry facilities. There were only two washers and two dryers, and one of the dryers was not working. All-in-all, we would definitely recommend this hotel to a family interested in saving some money while in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: jsr735_10
Reviews.Content: We needed an hotel in central Vancouver for a family wedding. The Landis hotel was right in the middle of the city and as such could not have been better. We had a small two bedroom suite which was immaculate in every way.The breakfast which was included in the cost was much better and more than we had anticipated. The various members of staff and especially the front desk could not have been more helpful. We really woiuld have to try hard to be critical. Happy to be asked for further comment. John Ramsay Edinburgh

Reviews.Title: “best value, very spacious suites, walking distance to shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: fortmac_eric
Reviews.Content: The only hotel in downtown Vancouver that have 2 bedroom suites. The spacious suite has a TV in each bedroom plus 1 in the living area, a full kitchen, and a dining area. You can walk to nearby stores, shops, and restaurants. The rooms are clean and the free wi-fi and continental breakfast were a plus. We'll definitely stay here again for our next Vancouver trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: BPCEugene
Reviews.Content: I checked the reviews before we booked, and they seemed better then the star rating. We gave it a try and I was impressed. Two bedrooms, one with a king and other with a double, and a pull out couch fit my family of two adults and two older children perfectly. Very clean room and friendly staff. The eating area really is all windows! Neighborhood was not upscale, and some racey establishments on Davies St., but some great restaurants. We walked to a greek and an italian restaurant on two different nights. And a short walk to the water taxi to Granville Island. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Space, well located”
Reviews.Author: Lind-Fran
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the Landis Hotel & Suites for 6 nights for a family wedding. We found the apartments well appointed and very spacious. It is great to have the extra space especially in the winter, there was no better feeling than to come through the door and be hit by a wonderful heated foyer! The staff were very helpful arranging taxis for our large group and also making restaurant bookings. The included breakfast, although continental, had a good variety and available until 10am. The location was very good, a short walk from the train, lots of restaurants in the location and easy to walk to Robson Street, Gas Town or the ferry to get to Granville Island. The only negative was the internet connection was very slow and seemed quite "patchy". Overall a great stay we really enjoyed our time there and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large apartments and super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SpikeJames
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for our daughter's wedding - she was married at the top of Grouse Mountain. Several of the wedding party stayed at the Landis. The apartments are large and well appointed ... TV in lounge and bedrooms. The hotel is located in an area with a range of restaurants and bars etc and an easy walk to the shopping areas ... and close to Granville Island. The staff were all very helpful going out of thier way to make our stay memorable. We highly recommend the Landis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SometimesSkiing
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this property. We use it for a couple of night prior to transfer to ski resort and to recover from fligths from Australia. The hotel is reasonable located to the downtown area and we find it is good value for money. We chosse this hotel for the 2 bedroom suites which we find very roomy and with good fittings. It was a shame that the pool was closed ude to renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place and friedly service”
Reviews.Author: marianela11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a nice surprise for this couple of 60+ who met with their daughter and husband for two weeks of holidays. The suite (two bedroom, living room area and kitchen) had a beautiful view of the mountains, was clean and quiet, breakfast was good, and the laundry service very convenient. The front desk has an excellent service maily provided by the General Manager who adds a very nice touch to their general friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality and feel like home comfort. One of the best place to stay in vancouver down town.”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep66
Reviews.Content: I was staying in landis for about three months during July to Sept. Before traveeling to vancouver, I have many concerns about my stay, like the hotel service and location . Landis in located in th heart of the down town and very close to Coast. The downtown view from the hotel is awesome. Everything accessable from the place where it located. The staffs in the hotel are very friendly and hospitality is excellent. Its worth for the pricing. I had a wonderful experience staying in landis. The suits in the hotel are specious and gives feel like home comfort. I liked the hotel very much. I recommend others to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for large groups”
Reviews.Author: Nipper100
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter, husband and I stayed at the Landis for four days. The setting was ideal. The spacious and clean two bed/two bath suite for 188.00 a night was a steal of a deal. The suite had a nicely equipped kitchenette (stove, microwave, dishwasher), separate dining and living areas. It also had a great glass-enclosed balcony where I sat every morning with my coffee and complimentary Globe and Mail. A complimentary continental breakfast is available until 10:00 AM, which is great because most places closes down by 9:00. A secure underground parking is available at $20.00 per night. Located within walking distance of all the major attractions, malls and parks. A couple of great grocery stores with excellent ready to heat meals are within a few blocks. Unfortunately the WiFi was slow and weak. It was good enough to get by with email. However, if you want to do lengthy work or download, it may be an issue. Being there during their cool part of the year, the heating system didn't seem to be working properly. We weren't freezing but still had to put on an extra sweater to keep the chill away.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest place in many travels.”
Reviews.Author: BigTraveller45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Landis Hotel with my wife and my sister-in-law. From the beginning, the General Manager, Khaled Ali, made us feel at home, and that he was truly glad to meet us. All of the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Besides having an excellent location for walking around Vancouver, what struck us mostly was the cleanliness of the Landis. So often, bathrooms are badly neglected by the staff. We could not find one speck of dirt anywhere in either bathroom. Thank you for operating a first-class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JohnMarg5
Reviews.Content: Disappointed we were not advised when booking that swimming pool, fitness centre and spa were closed for renovations, otherwise good location, comfortable and clean rooms each with own TV and good sized bathroom in our 2 bdr suite. No cooked breakfast but continental breakfast was included in price and was very adequate, helpful reception except when main persons were not there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Families and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Neilsnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Suite for nine nights. The room was of a very good size with full kitchen, full bathroom, dining room, sitting room and two bedrooms. Excellent value for money as provides continential breakfast for free each morning. Room decor is a little dated now but it is very tidy and perfectly adequate. It is a bit of a walk down to Robson St etc but the hotel also has a free shuttle. Overall if I was in Vancouver again, I would have no hesitation going back. Great hotel with two small children.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Wayne12367
Reviews.Content: This hotel which consisits of suite accommodations is well located in Downtown Vancouver allowing easy walking to most of the attractions.. Everything is at the door as far as resturants and transport is concerned. Yaletown Skytrain stop is a 5 minute walk away whereas it is only a comfortable 20 minutes stroll to Canada Place or Stanley Park. The Robson street shopping area is also very easy to reach by foot. The suite was large and with two bathrooms that was excellent for a group of four adults. It was very clean and serviced daily. A continental breakfast is included in the rate and although very bland and short of choice it did get the day off to a good start. The Hop off Hop on trolley stop is next door . Would stay at the Landis again when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: krabbir95
Reviews.Content: i HAPPENED UPON THIS HOTEL AFTER THE FIRST HOTEL I HAD WAS HORRIBLE!!!! I was greeted with friendly staff and thanked them profusely for allowing me to check in at such late notice. The room was amazing and even though the phone didnt work the front desk staff member came upstairs to replace the phone. She was amazing.....I will definitely be back. Bathroom were clean,towels were great.....everything was awesome

Reviews.Title: “Great City Location and View”
Reviews.Author: SuzTim
Reviews.Content: We found the Landis through the Visitor's Center upon our arrival in Vancouver. We wanted a hotel in the city with easier access to all the areas in the city that we wanted to visit. The Landis was a good choice. It was convenient, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and very willing to offer suggestions regarding our sightseeing. We felt very safe in our walks at night and we especially enjoyed the big windowed, porch like area in our room. We would stay there again should we travel to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us - 2 adults and a teen. The suite had 2 bedrooms, a kitchenette and a large bathroom. The rate includes breakfast - cold cereal, fruit, bagels, pastries, etc. - which was very nice. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful with directions, etc. The location is great - at the intersection of Yaletown, West End and False Creek. The entire city is within an easy walk. Public buses run right by the hotel and you can pick up a transit pass at the 7-Eleven right across the street. Granville Island is easily accessible by ferry from the foot of Hornby St - 4 block away. There are many great restaurant options in the area, from quick serve to white tablecloth. I didn't use the fitness center, but it looked well appointed. The jacuzzi was a welcomed afternoon stop after days of walking, hiking and biking. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but need better soundproofing!”
Reviews.Author: skysthelimitOntario
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room in a quiet part of the hotel.Good location for touring downtown Vancouver, Visit the Salathai Thai restaurant close to the hotel for great thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, terrible customer service, not clean”
Reviews.Author: YYZTravel123
Reviews.Content: We booked the Landis because we heard from a friend that it was in a decent location and reasonably priced. Fair enough. It was in an ok location but that's about all. Upon our arrival, we were not greeted with a very welcoming staff. Not one person at the front desk offered us any information about the amenities the hotel provided or even surrounding amenities. Although check in was fairly quick. Once entering our room, it had an odd odour to it. I would describe it as dampness and mildew. The bathroom was not clean and the towels did not smell great and were very old. When using the shower for the first time, it was completely clogged, which caused the bath to fill with water rather quickly. I then saw black particles floating in the water. I rather not know what it was. Don't bother asking for towels. Just go down to the front desk and get them yourself. If you ask, you'll wait and wait...and wait...and wait...and never get them. They only have one person at the front desk most of the time, therefore nobody is available to assist you with anything. We also called the front desk to ask for some suggestions on restaurants around the neighbourhood. The lady did not know. How do you not know? Whether you live in the area or not, know at least one restaurant in which you can recommend to your customers. She guided us to some black binder which was completely useless. On our last day, front desk did call a cab to pick us up--but of course it was a friend of the person who called. Just like it was a friend who has an advertisement in the lobby for a day trip to Whistler (we ended up going with someone else for our Whistler trip. I called the number on the ad and he was very rude and was not willing to answer my questions and sounded annoyed). Not that I have a problem with giving your friend some business, but that was the only time this man at the front desk was willing to do something. So, we were glad to be leaving this hotel, we sign the bill and all of that and rather than saying thank you, the man at the front desk proceeded to pick up the phone and talk to someone who sounded like a friend. We were there for four nights and not even a simple thank you? Who ever is running this hotel needs to give their employees a refresher on customer service...or better yet, let's start with some manners. I could go on for days about how much we hated this hotel. Don't be fooled just because they have suites. You're better off staying at a hotel closer to downtown that isn't a suite. I'm sure you'll at least get a thank you. I would never stay here again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, warm, spacious: a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: LAFScarsdale
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this all-suite hotel with my two daughters ages 17 and 31. There are only 4 suites per floor, so the hotel is exceptionally quiet. They offer a free shuttle to (but not back from) any place on the island, and we often took the shuttle there and then walked back, as the location of the hotel was perfect. The personnel at the front desk were so pleasant, welcoming, and helpful. The suite itself was spotless, nicely furnished, and had beautiful views. They honestly advertised their breakfast as "continental", but the pastries were excellent as was the coffee. This was my 4th trip to Vancouver, but I will be back. I already checked their long-term rates!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room for 4 adults”
Reviews.Author: Flyawy
Reviews.Content: Like: Floor plan - living room is in between the two bedrooms, gives privacy when traveling with another couple or grown up children. Location - ideal for exploring downtown on feet. Hop-on/Hop-off sightseeing bus is right in front of the hotel. Remember to ask for $2/each off coupon at front desk (we didn't know). Service - continental breakfast/beverages are great, all we had to do was cook some bacon and eggs in our full size kitchen. Room were cleaned everyday while we were gone. Frontdesk was not so great about recommendations but friendly. Don't like: The blanket on the pull out sofa bed had food stain. No blackout curtain in the living room, difficult for a good night rest on the sofa bed. The description on the check out bill is none descriptive. Such as 'HST + Transit Levy', AHRT, Room HST', they are codes not description. Great location for restaurants and attractions but on the edge of not so good neighborhood. You'll see drunks, people come up for changes and party noise all night. Tips: Reserve a dinner + show + valet parking package for $35 at Comedy Mix located at Century Plaza Hotel on 1015 Burrard St. We were surprised the 2 courses dinner were plenty and really good. The comedy show was entertaining as well. We ate at Hapa Izakaya Japanese restaurant on 1479 Robson St., it was good and the waitress were very friendly and pretty. However, there are a lot of Japanese and Korean restaurants on this part of Robson looked interesting. Go take a walk down the street, check out the menus, the crowd and then choose a restaurant. Avoid: Sala Thai Restaurant on Burrard St., if you are picky about Thai food. The service was not so good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: annazam
Reviews.Content: We've always opted to stay in serviced suites whenever we visited Vancouver because of we have 6 year old. Initially, we were going to stay at another well rated serviced suite in Robson but decided to try this one because of the reviews. And it did not disappoint. Pros: -Rooms were larger by far ( as mentioned in their website ) - very clean rooms and bathroom ( housekeeping comes in daily) - free Internet in the room - breakfast was substantial enough to feed children ( cold breakfast was served at 2nd flr) - location was close to nearby restaurants ( walking distance to Davie St) and a 7 eleven is located across the street Cons - Parking charges are nightly ( wish they could do it complimentary ) - Washing Machine and Dryer facilities are minimal (Given that they cater to longer staying accommodations, they should expand this more. They were located at the 2nd flr, one pair in the female / male locker room) Other than that, staff was very helpful and friendly and we would definitely come back. -

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great service!”
Reviews.Author: dsherven
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights at the Landis with my husband and 2 teenage girls. The suite-style hotel is a terrific was to travel with family. Lots of room for everyone to relax, the convenience of a kitchen, and a handy location to walk anywhere in the downtown area. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would most definitely say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a group”
Reviews.Author: glovygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 19 year old son and our daughter and her husband to Vancouver for a long weekend. This hotel was ideal for the 5 of us. We had two bedrooms ( each with TV) two bathrooms, a kitchen, living room (with sofa bed TV and DVD player) , dining area plus a small enclosed terrace. We could all be together and yet not be on top of each other. A In addition, there was a continental breakfast served every morning, plus an indoor pool and spa- the spa was most welcome after hours of sightseeing. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Location was central and we walked all over.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: beach_bb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located and within walking distance to main attractions. It was several blocks to the Canada train line (Yaletown), so if you don't mind walking you can take the skytrain from the airport and walk to the hotel. Our group consisted of relatively fit adults so we walked to Robson and even to Stanley Park from the hotel. There was a free shuttle that you can book on the day to go anywhere within the downtown area. It is on a first come first served basis though, so go early to sign up at the front desk. Continental breakfast was included, we had choices of cereal, pastries, bagels, fruits, coffee and juice. Nothing fancy, you can eat in the breakfast room or take a tray up to your room. We thoroughly enjoyed eating at our sundrenched dinning nook in our own suite. The suite was tidy and neat. Every room had a TV with a large selection of cable channels (so THREE in total). Wi-fi was conveniently available as well. The kitchen was stocked with pots and pans, toaster, coffee machine, kettle and cutlery. The master suite was extremely spacious with double sinks, shower and tub in the ensuite. The second bedroom also has a Queen size bed, a very spacious closet but the square footage substantially smaller. (In fact, it was a bit tight). The main bathroom is not adjoining, it was clean but also smaller. The living room had a double pull out couch and next to it, a lovely enclosed sunroom. On a busy street and with the large windows throughout, so sirens could be heard. Not an issue for me but could be for some. All in all, a great value for family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic, Great Price, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: mzimmermann
Reviews.Content: The Landis was AMAZING! HUGE, beautiful, clean rooms for a VERY affordable price! Lots of room for 4 adults + 2 kids. Very family friendly, great staff (especially the "bald man" lol), delicious continental breakfast. Rooms are so quiet with many ammenities. Central downtown location. Walking distance to Granville ferry, Kitsilano, Robson Street (and other shopping). Quick driving distance to Stanley Park and Gastown. Reasonable parking rate in a secure underground parking area. Best: The value for the space. Worst: Location -- great to be central, downtown not the best place to leave at night with young children. My Blogged Review: http://meadowmama.wordpress.com/2010/07/07/traveling-with-kids-accomodation-and-meals

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, extremely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jenygirl68
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for two nights before our cruise. The price of two hotel rooms was very expensive and then I came across L'andis Suites. We had a two bedroom/two bathroom suite. We arrived late in the evening and I was a little worried because I was a little disappoionted when I saw the entrance. The lady who was working was very friendly and was helpful when I asked her about finding somewhere close to eat. The suite was spotless when we entered. If you are looking for something fancy with room service and pay per view movies, this place is not for you. It had a nice kitchen, which we did not use since we did not stay very long. We ate the continental breakfast both mornings and the food was good. It is typical muffins, cereal, fruit, juice, etc. My only complaint was other guests were in there eating without any shoes on. There wasn't a sign posted but I think they should put one on the door. We used their free shuttle to Stanley Park and to the cruise ship terminal. The staff at the front desk was always friendly and helpful. There were a few sirens at night but nothing that disturbed our sleep. Overall a pleasant experience and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suites with well kept facilities, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: duhart
Reviews.Content: Floor to ceiling windows makes for a light and airy space with a sun room just of the living room. Close to good restaurants on Davie Street. A short walk to the ferry for Granville Island. Buses just outside the hotel. Parking is well worth paying the extra as street parking can be hard to get. Do remember that Davie Street nightlife can go till the wee hours, so get a soom away from the street if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service, Rooms Could Use Some More Things”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are considering relocating to Vancouver and so we wanted to stay for 8 days to check out the city and have a full apartment style hotel room. After scouring the internet for what I thought would be the best place I decided to book a room here. We ended up paying over $1700 for our stay here, so I'd say that's a pretty significant amount of money. The first 3 days of our stay we were woken up by street construction from a jackhammer at 8 am on Davie Street. This was pretty terrible and resulted in some bad sleep from both of us. Nothing could have been more irritating than the construction from about 8 am to to 10 am every day. We had to sleep with earplugs to not have a heart attack waking up in the morning. What I liked about the hotel: The maids are super friendly and helpful, they tried to come in and clean every day even though we did not need it They change your towels and bed sheets every day, I would ask next time to not worry so much about this since it's wasteful They have a pool, hot tub and gym There's a good amount of space in the suite All the appliances you need in the kitchen King sized bed Japanese tea pot, that was neat and we actually used it and bought some loose tea What was missing that could have made our stay better: Kitchen supplies: cutting board, knives, frying pan, colander, blender not provided Only 1 washing machine for the whole hotel, the one in the ladies change room by the pool was out of service the entire stay, that is ridiculous The breakfast was not really health food friendly, we're vegan so we did not eat it, we would have liked some good fruit to be offered instead of cereal and milk and crappy muffins The pillows were basic small ones, I was really hoping to have some plush king sized soft pillows The internet is REALLY slow, you can't even watch youtube, let alone download or upload something. We work from home on our internet business and this basically meant we were inefficient for 8 days working online. I expect much better from an Executive hotel. The light switch situation is a little out of control there are I think 11 or 12 light switches in the whole suite, all out side of the rooms and some of them work and some of them don't, so you have no idea what light switch is for what. PLEASE LABEL THEM or remove ones that do not work. Light switches for bedrooms are a necessity. The tv did not work for us, it said signal scrambled. So we didn't bother. We tried plugging our laptops into the outlets in the living room and some of the outlets did not work. Only 1 out of a set of two worked for some reason, so that was frustrating. Only one of the windows opened in our dining room, the other one the handle was broken off, so it was hard to get some air in the room. The living room is completely sealed off. So we had 1 window in each bedroom that could open and 1 in the glass dining room. I told the front desk after a few days that we would have liked some extra kitchen amenities and pillows. Pillows and a colander showed up the next morning. That afternoon we received some larger eating bowls. The ones provided are toddler sized and pretty useless. And then 3 days before we left we received a frying pan outside of our door, so we cooked a stir fry that night. It was nice to get them, but any kitchen should be equipped with these things. It would have been nice to be able to make a smoothie in the morning with a blender. Almost every suite we book has a blender for morning smoothies. I really hope the hotel can provide some extra amenities. Because for the price we paid we feel like we could have had more if we stayed somewhere else. This is Vancouver, but we could have booked a resort somewhere for cheaper. We thought about moving hotels half way but we had already bought groceries and settled in and it would have been too much hassle to pack it up and get a cab out. Kitchen supplies, pillows and faster internet are a must when catering to business people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, delicious breakfast and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Moraymorgans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Landis for five nights when we first arrived in Canada. We are a couple in our thirties travelling with our two year old son and two of his grandparents! We chose this hotel as having two bedrooms in one suite was ideal for two couples and a baby. Was so lovely to have a living room and dining space as well as our rooms and to be able to cook and eat together etc. The rooms were immaculate, fairly basic decor but very clean and spacious. We booked a king bed in one room and a double in the other room. I have to say the bed in the second room was pretty small and probably suited for one rather than two adults! The kitchen was fully functional with everything we needed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Lovely clean pool and fitness area. Continental breakfast was included in the price and we just brought it back to the rooms to eat. DELICIOUS muffins, juice, cereal, pastries, seeded bagels and lots of fruit etc. We stocked up and ended up not needing lunch! Free wireless in the room was great and big TVs in every room. Would certainly recommend this if you're looking for a clean, comfortable space in the main downtown area at reasonable rate. We'd certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value and Location”
Reviews.Author: julie2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. We have 4 children, and it was great to have 2 bedrooms + the pullout sofa. We enjoyed the breakfast. It is within walking distance to many downtown locations. We loved it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel when you are travelling with small kids”
Reviews.Author: aethalaine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks in the double suite. All the rooms have two bedrooms, two baths with a living room and full kitchen. We have 3 toddlers so we needed to have a single apt. This is the only hotel I could find in Vancouver which had two bedrooms. It was great value because we ended up paying what we would have paid to get two seperate rooms in a regular hotel, which would not have a kitchen or a living room. There is a basement carpark which I found very useful as you can go straight up on the lift from the carpark to your suite - this is great when you have strollers and lots of bags, plus no one needs to get wet if it rains. You do have to pay for parking though. There is a coin operated laundry room in the hotel which is super convenient and the 7 Eleven right oppsite the hotel (literally 1min away) ensures that you can always get all your neccessites quickly. Location is fantastic - West Van, Stanley Park just mins away. Staff were super friendly, great with the little ones, and very helpful. Free wireless internet was available. Gets a bit noisy at night due to being in the middle of the city - sirens are the main culprit, so try to get a high floor facing away from the street. Overall, an excellent stay. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Landis Hotel, Great Place and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ernie47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Landis Hotel during the Easter Weekend break. The room, a two bedroom suite, was excellent and the service from the front desk, the room service, and the breakfast special (included), was first class. I recommend this facility for anyone wanting excellent accommodation in downtown Vancouver. Your stay will be enhanced by choosing this hotel. Ernie

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: Eric22754
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in a 2 bedroom suite at Landis Suites with my wife and children. Location couldn't be better. Walking distance to downtown & Granville Island. Short ride to everywhere else of interest. The suite is a very good size. Lots of room. Clean and comfortable. Amenities are very good. Used the kitchen for breakfast and snacks. Would definitely stay there again. My wife is in Vancouver regularly. She found it to be much better value than the hotels in which she normally stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business trips with family”
Reviews.Author: IfieO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference and would highly recommend for anyone traveling with family and/or in need of multiple bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: HandyMannyLondon
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 bedroom suite and sofa bed, which slept 5 and baby comfortably. Kitchen facilities ok with seperate dining area, continental breakfast provided, allowed to take breakfast back to your apartment which was good as the breakfast room considerably small. Free one way hotel shuttle, great conveinence. Supermarkets within walking distance, as are most attractions. Hop on/Hop off trolley tour stops at building next to hotel. Great value for money, in particular for large groups. Negative points - construction going on close by - not noisy, but an eyesore and if sleeping in the living room, doesn't have full curtains to draw.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very comfortable suite,lots of room.”
Reviews.Author: Blackiesbeach
Reviews.Content: Travelled with adult son & daughter, so the 2 bedrooms and pullout sofa were utilised. Main bedroom had a huge kingsized bed but was rock hard,2nd bedroom had queen and better mattress, sofa bed was comfortable. Only complaint would be lounge area only had light curtains and so sunlight at 4am streamed in, also no privacy at night. Granville Street and the nightlife is only a few blocks away, safe walking. Everywhere else....Robson St, Davie St, Stanley Park, Canada Place,Granville Markets etc is an easy walk. Skytrain and buses are also close by. Cabs out the front. Staff were mainly helpful but if you need a toaster or something fixed you must keep asking. Took 4 requests for toilet tissue to be sent up. Check after room service as that is something they do not seem to top up. We booked an extra night......they forgot and cancelled our cardkey, so had to get that going again...little things were annoying but Staff did apologize, and eventually fix them. Would definately recommend and stay again...so easy to navigate around Vancouver from here and the extra space is ideal for more than 2 people.Check an upgrade to a 2 bathroom suite for 2 couples, if available. Indoor pool & gym area were clean and well maintained. Overall met all our needs and very tourist friendly location.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: 2BizzyTravlin
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite and found it to be clean, roomy, and well appointed. Personally, I prefer a soft mattress, but it's fine for those who don't mind a hard bed. The shower in the master BR was designed for tall people. I'm 5'3" and the shower spray hit me in the face and couldn't be adjusted. If I booked again, I would request a room that didn't face the street. Because it's downtown, there is the typical street noise at night: sirens etc. Our 14 year old had a room that did not face the street and noise was not an issue for him. He loved having his own private room w/TV a double bed and bath. He also loved having a 7-11 across the street for snacks. Overall it was a good 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay & the price is great too!!”
Reviews.Author: pbarbee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel (once in 2002 & 2009) both times going on a cruise. Location is wonderful. You can walk to almost anything downtown from here. The view (you can see the water & the mountains too) is really nice. The free downtown shuttle is great & the drivers are very nice & give a mini tour with information when taking you places. The price was was great! We got a 2 bedroom suite for much less than we could have gotten just 2 regular hotel rooms & the rooms were much larger than a regular hotel. The staff was really friendly & helpful. The free continental breakfast was ok & there is a kitchen with dishes & everything if you want more. Several small grocery stories within walking distance. Also there is a computer in the lobby that you can use for 30minutes without a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a family of 5”
Reviews.Author: SugarlanderTexas
Reviews.Content: When travelling with my family (husband, 2 teens and a tween) finding the right accomodations in an expensive city like Vancouver is a challenge. A single hotel room won't do and getting two rooms is usually too expensive. The Landis turned out to be just right for us. We got the two bedroom, two bath unit. There was room to spread out, and enough tvs(3) and bathrooms to go around. The free internet was very convenient. As another poster noted it's a little worn around the edges. To pick some nits - the sheets were very very thin and the pull out couch was broken. Also, late night noise from the street was very loud during the week-end but this was during St. Patricks so might not have been typical. The place is kept clean, the kitchen well stocked, the free breakfast delicious if not very nutritous (my kids loved the chocolate croissants and cookies) and most of all, the location very central. Great for walking around. Area seemed safe enough even at night. They also have great big windows and a glassed in porch which we enjoyed. After booking with them through their website I found a cheaper rate elsewhere - mentioned it to them and they honored the lower price. Overall a good value and a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family accommodation in central Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: KiwiwithKids
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 3 teenage children and stayed at the Landis between Xmas and New Year Dec08/Jan09 in a 2 bedroom suite. We had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, plus one of the children slept on the roll out bed in the lounge area. It was excellent to have 3 TV's so that everyone could watch their own choice of programme. The kitchen had ample facilities for us to cook meals when we needed and the breakfast provided was a generous continental breakfast with cereal, toast, croissants, muffins, tea and coffee - although the room was quite small and busy, we could always get a table. Although there was a building site right next door, this was never an issue as we were always out during the day and the builders did not work at night. There was considerable noise at night, but nothing other than usual city sounds and it certainly didn't keep us awake. Unfortunately the master bed was very hard - not just slightly, but very hard and you certainly didn't "sink" into the mattress. After the first night we got used to it and slept well. The laundry was convenient but the drier took forever to dry clothes - still more convenient than going to a laundromat. We found the hotel location excellent - close enough to walk to the downtown area even in the snow, and lots of public transport nearby. Great family restaurants within a 5 min walk to the north of the hotel and we felt quite safe walking to these areas at night. We too had great difficult getting our key cards to work and it took several attempts for them to operate - you just get used to it! Reception staff were very helpful and were happy to store our luggage when we went to Vancouver Island for a few days. We enjoyed our stay and the facilities and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: Africandaisy
Reviews.Content: Generally I find hotel accomodation in Vancouver to be problematic. Its over-priced and inadequate. Planning a 5 night stay in Vancouver to visit friends and family I initially booked a single room at a Holiday Inn at $169 a night. I changed this to the Landis because I could get a 2 bedroomed suite for roughly the same cost. I was not disappointed. The accomodation is of a decent standard. Pretty clean although a bit frayed around the edges. The beds were not great I have to say - hard and somewhat "flat" and still using the good old brown hotel blanket rather then a comforter. There is a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and full size 'fridge. Plenty of closet space, good shower, 3 TVs, a DVD player. Apart from the beds it was fine. Housekeeping was prompt and efficient. The breakfast was good by Canadian hotel standards - nothing hot but plenty of pastries and yogurt, cereal etc. There is a coin-operated laundry and the pool and fitness area were fine too. Overall I enjoyed my stay here. The staff were helpful when you needed them but unobtrusive otherwise which I like. The key cards were a bit of a hassle but nothing that ruined my day and parking ($14 a day) good. I liked that you could access the rooms straight from the garage. It was also very well sound-proofed from other guest noise (although to be fair the hotel was pretty empty when we were there) Location is good - walking distance to everything you may need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: PearlVision2
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night in Vancouver after an 8 hour plane ride so that we could relax before taking the drive up to Whistler the next day. We looked for a reasonably priced property with 2 bedrooms, centrally located in Vancouver. The Landis fit this description perfectly. It is a wonderful mid-tier property that offers excellent value, particularly for families or groups. Don't let the exterior of the building fool you. The property's facade is quiet and non-descript . When we pulled up to the curb, we were tempted to cancel our reservation at the Landis and check into the familiar Marriott Residence Inn, which is adjacent to the Landis. However, we decided to at least look at the Landis' rooms and I'm so glad we did. We had reserved the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite which costs less than CAD200/night and includes free wireless internet and free continental breakfast. The suite was spacious, comfortable and perfect for a family with children. The kitchen is well stocked with necessities including coffee, tea, microwave, full size refigerator, dishwasher, etc. The bedrooms are adequately sized and each has its own television. The living room is well apportioned, the dining room has seating for 5 and there is also a small patio terrace with table and chairs. The Landis has limited staff, so when we called them at 5 am (still hadn't adjusted to local time so we were up early) to get the user name and password to access the Internet, no on answered the phone despite long rings. However by 6 am, the staff was available and helped us with no problems. The breakfast is good and they offer underground parking for about CAD14.00/night. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Minkie1
Reviews.Content: We were delighted by the clean, comfortable and spacious rooms and facilities provided. The free breakfast was simple but appropriate and satisfied all the children. The spa was a delight. The proximity of the hotel to local shopping sites and the CBD was excellent and the free shuttle a bonus. The manager understood the meaning of the term " service" and no problem was too difficult to resolve. His ongoing good cheer and practical advice, and his willingness to find solutions to our needs, was greatly appreciated. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Landis Olympics Rates”
Reviews.Author: kateapple
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking about staying at the Landis for the Olympics, here's the quote I got back from them: Executive Suite: $657.00+15% tax/ per night Deluxe Suite: $747.00+15% tax/ per night **Minimum length of stay: 21days **50% non refundable deposit at time of booking **Balance of payment 180 days prior to arrival Personally, I think this is reprehensible. The host city is called "host" for a reason — and it's not for price-gouging.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem in the middle of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Canguy86
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children (3 & 5 yrs) decided to spend a few days in Vancouver to work through the jetlag (8 hours time difference) before heading up to Whistler for a week of skiing. I would highly recommend the Landis Suites as a wonderful place to stay, both for families and business travellers alike. We had a wonderful two bedroom suite which was clean, large and well appointed -- the free wireless internet was also a great perk. The staff were very helpful (especially the manager, Kalid, who went out of his way to make our stay as pleasant as possible) and the continental breakfast was better than we expected. Although this is by no means a complaint, our only warning is to make sure you pay attention where you park your car -- their car park levels are a bit confusing (i.,e. split into no-so-clearly named half-levels) and so it's quite easy to lose your car. We had a bit of a panic when we thought our car had been towed/stolen when in fact it was simply on a different level.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: AverageFamily
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a family. Area of Vancouver is quite colourful but the accomodation was excellent. Only hiccup was that our booking was lost when we checked in. This was qucikly fixed by the staff. Brekkie room is excellent and facilities very good. Plenty of space and heaps better than a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Rianthe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight with another couple post cruise and found the Landis to be perfect for our needs. It was the best price around and they were extremely helpful when checking in, holding our luggage and letting us check in early. The suite was clean and comfortable and well set up. We were extremely pleased to have secure parking. Security in the building was a bit cumbersome (having to swipe your card for elevator, etc.) but well above average - a nice plus. We were only here for one night and had dinner at a friend's house, so I can't tell you much about the immediate area. But it is located downtown and is easy to find. And the continental breakfast wasn't huge, but it had everything we needed to fill up for our day (pastries, cereals, toast, juice, coffee, etc.). And some of it appears home made.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fantastic people!!”
Reviews.Author: emzak
Reviews.Content: My family comprising of my Mum & Dad, me & my young son (3 years old) all stayed in a great 2 bedroomed apartment at this hotel. What really struck me is how friendly all the staff are here, they go out of there way to help your with everything you can think of. The maid service was brilliant & the breakfast was practical with cereals, fresh fruit, toast, bagels, orange juice & lots of cakes buns etc. There is a small breakfast room which was quite busy, but there were trays available to take breakfast back to your room if you preffered. The apartment itself was very spacious with great views out of the windows overlooking downtown Vancouver (see photo) Its still fair to say that it is not quiet but I never got woken up at night, I did hear the sounds of a busy city which you would hear anywhere in Vancouver.......The winter olympics are being held here & Whistler in 2010 so there is going to be a lot of redelopment in the area! I would stay here again & I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: prefer_not_to_say
Reviews.Content: The Landis is a great choice for anyone wanting plenty of space in a clean, well-maintained property in west Vancouver. The room I had was much more a two bedroom condo, than a hotel room. There were two full baths, a complete kitchen (full size appliances!), living and dining areas, and two bedrooms. One bedroom had a king bed, huge closet and good sized dresser. The other had a queen bed, big closet and dresser. Both had TVs, a view, and partially opening windows. The living and dining areas had opening windows, a table with seats for four, sofa, coffee table and TV, as well as a small coat closet. There was also a small solarium off the living area with a window that opened far enough to make it more of a balcony. Having two full baths was very handy; we always had plenty of towels and there was never any congestion when getting ready to go out. There is a free breakfast in the morning, though the hours could be a bit longer. It has a good selection of muffins, breads, fruit, bagels, juices and coffee. I didn't try out the pool or the fitness facility, but they seemed to be adequate. There are washers and dryers located in the fitness area change rooms. Parking is reasonable for a city hotel, and is secured by a card lock gate. Wireless internet access is free. There is a morning paper Monday to Saturday. We had a couple of small maintenance issues, which were handled promptly by the hotel staff. The location is great; easy walking distance to many different tourist destinations and the hotel has a free shuttle. There are plenty of restaurants and bar in the area, as well as shops to stock up on your own food and drink. I'd highly recommend the Landis to anyone who needs a hotel suite offering lots of space, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesunclan
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location for our family of 5. So close to downtown & Granville Island etc. yet 10 minutes walk from peaceful English Bay & Stanley Park. The community was friendly and vibrant. The suite was spacious and room service was good. The car parking facility was great. The gym and pool facilities were good. Disadvantages we experienced were: a) construction work was being carried out at the back of the hotel which was a bit noisy! b) the laundry facilities could definitely be improved - having the machines (only 1 of each) in the ladies & gents' changing rooms is not ideal! c) we were unable to get internet access for the duration of our stay for some reason - I hope they resolve this problem soon!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hindhede
